*[Bug 18861] drop.terms fails to drop RHS variable when the formula only has on variable on the RHS*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18861>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
Thank you, Benedikt, for the report, and Heather for a first patch and
subsequent collaboration.
Finally, the best fix was to __generalize__ the `reformulate()` function to
also work with an "empty" formula.

Committed to R-devel in svn r87779.
